title: Japan to remove ambassador to China in September: reports
description: The Japanese government has decided to remove Ambassador to China Uichiro Niwa in September because he could not handle 'complicated situations', Sankei Shimbun reported on Monday.
cleanContent:
Japanese envoy to China Uichiro Niwa

By Mei Jingya, Sina EnglishThe Japanese government has decided to remove Ambassador to China Uichiro Niwa in September because he could not handle 'complicated situations', Sankei Shimbun reported on Monday.Uichiro Niwa has been criticized by hard line Japanese politicians at home for his “tender stance on China”. He warned last month that plans by the Tokyo municipal government to buy the Diaoyu Islands in the East China Sea could trigger an "extremely grave crisis" between the two powers.The ambassador was recalled to Tokyo on July 15 by Japan’s foreign minister Koichiro Gemba for discussions amid simmering tension over Diaoyu Islands in the East China Sea, requiring the envoy to "accurately convey" Tokyo's stance to Beijing.Uichiro Niwa, a former chairman of the Itochu trading conglomerate, became the first Japanese ambassador to Beijing appointed from the private sector in June 2010.A foreign affairs official said the he will likely be removed of his duties after September 29. The Japanese government is now looking for a candidate to succeed him. The timing coincides with the 40th anniversary of normalization of Sino-Japanese relations.Related news: | |
